dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: ...so, wait, it's like, a returns company, but they give you your money back before you even send the thing back?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...so, wait, it's like, a returns company, but they give you your money back before you even send the thing back?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, well, not exactly money back. It's store credit. But, like, instantly. That's Returnly's whole thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, well, not exactly money back. It's store credit. But, like, instantly. That's Returnly's whole thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Returnly offers store credit, rather than cash, in the hope that shoppers will spend the amount they are credited and then some.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Store credit, okay. But still, how do they know? What if I just keep it? The, uh, the item, I mean.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Store credit, okay. But still, how do they know? What if I just keep it? The, uh, the item, I mean.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: That's, um, the secret sauce, right? They've built this system where they assess your risk profile. Like, they look at your shopping history across all their partnered retailers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's, um, the secret sauce, right? They've built this system where they assess your risk profile. Like, they look at your shopping history across all their partnered retailers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This essentially means it analyzes a consumers past shopping activity at the retailers that it works with to make a decision.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so they, like, track you? That's a bit, uh, much.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so they, like, track you? That's a bit, uh, much.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's for this specific service. And because they do it, they say they can offer instant credit to about 85% of customers. It's pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's for this specific service. And because they do it, they say they can offer instant credit to about eighty five percent of customers. It's pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company says that by assessing a shoppers risk, it can offer store credit to 85% of customers on the spot, without first requiring that the item has been received or even put in the mail.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, eighty-five percent. But, like, what's in it for the store? Or for Returnly, I guess?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, eighty-five percent. But, like, what's in it for the store? Or for Returnly, I guess?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: For the store, it's huge. Customers, um, they don't get stuck in that payment delay limbo. And Returnly says nine out of ten customers then immediately buy something else.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For the store, it's huge. Customers, um, they don't get stuck in that payment delay limbo. And Returnly says nine out of ten customers then immediately buy something else.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nine in ten have ordered a second item before they even shipped the first unwanted item back, the company says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Immediately? So they're, like, getting people to spend more?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Immediately? So they're, like, getting people to spend more?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Data shows those customers often outspend their original order by, like, 28%. So the retailers love it. It's revenue generation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Data shows those customers often outspend their original order by, like, twenty eight percent. So the retailers love it. It's revenue generation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Theyre likely to outspend the original size of their order, too, by 23%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So Returnly just, uh, trusts people? What if someone does just keep the item after getting the credit?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Returnly just, uh, trusts people? What if someone does just keep the item after getting the credit?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: That's the risk they take, uh, but they actively work to minimize it. They use nudges, offer conveniences like pre-printed labels, even scheduled pickups.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the risk they take, uh, but they actively work to minimize it. They use nudges, offer conveniences like pre-printed labels, even scheduled pickups.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In such an event, says Vilar, it can nudge a customer over email or try to make a return easier by sending a printed return label in the mail, for example, or scheduling the pickup of an item.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So they're betting on, like, convenience making people honest, or something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So they're betting on, like, convenience making people honest, or something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. And it's working for them. They've processed, like, over $220 million in returns, total funding's up to $36 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. And it's working for them. They've processed, like, over two hundred twenty dollars million in returns, total funding's up to thirty six dollars million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has processed close to $200 million in returns in the last three years... This brings the companys total funding up to $30 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they've got, um, a massive line of credit to actually finance all those instant returns.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they've got, um, a massive line of credit to actually finance all those instant returns.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It also took out a line of credit earlier this year that enables it to finance $300 million in returns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So it's basically making returns, uh, painless, but also kinda... profitable for everyone involved, except maybe me when I overspend.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's basically making returns, uh, painless, but also kinda... profitable for everyone involved, except maybe me when I overspend.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Ha, yeah, well, that's the hope, right? Better customer experience means more sales.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ha, yeah, well, that's the hope, right? Better customer experience means more sales.
